gobblin.restli.throttling

Class LimiterServerResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linkedin.restli.server.resources.ResourceContextHolder
      • com.linkedin.restli.server.resources.ComplexKeyResourceAsyncTemplate<gobblin.restli.throttling.PermitRequest,com.linkedin.restli.common.EmptyRecord,gobblin.restli.throttling.PermitAllocation>
        • gobblin.restli.throttling.LimiterServerResource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.linkedin.restli.server.resources.BaseResource, com.linkedin.restli.server.resources.ComplexKeyResourceAsync<gobblin.restli.throttling.PermitRequest,com.linkedin.restli.common.EmptyRecord,gobblin.restli.throttling.PermitAllocation>, com.linkedin.restli.server.resources.KeyValueResource<com.linkedin.restli.common.ComplexResourceKey<gobblin.restli.throttling.PermitRequest,com.linkedin.restli.common.EmptyRecord>,gobblin.restli.throttling.PermitAllocation>

    @Alpha
public class LimiterServerResource
extends com.linkedin.restli.server.resources.ComplexKeyResourceAsyncTemplate<gobblin.restli.throttling.PermitRequest,com.linkedin.restli.common.EmptyRecord,gobblin.restli.throttling.PermitAllocation>
    Restli resource for allocating permits through Rest calls. Simply calls a Limiter in the server configured through SharedResourcesBroker.

        Request permits from the limiter server. The returned PermitAllocation specifies the number of permits that the client can use.
